results.title: Too many Captain Cooks
results.brief_description: This film seeks to replace the stereotypes promoted by the non-Aboriginal history of white settlement in Australia which usually begins with the ‘discoveries’ of Captain Cook. Here history is re-told from the point-of-view of the colonised: ‘Aboriginals discovered Captain Cook’. In Northern Australia white people are referred to as ‘Captain Cooks’. The film’s form is sensitive to the telling of tribal history of Captain Cook as spoken by Paddy Wambarranga of the Rembarrnga tribe in Arnhem Land. This history is also represented by images of Aboriginal art. Rembarrnga and Kriol dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Top gun
results.creator_credit: Tony Scott, Jerry Bruckheimer, Don Simpson and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Tony Scott, “Top gun” was the film that catapulted Tom Cruise into mega stardom. Cruise plays Lieutenant Pete ‘Maverick’ Mitchell, a hotshot navy pilot, with no respect for rules, regulations or authority. Maverick is training at the Top Gun Naval Flying School, where he is out to prove himself to be the best of the best, at all costs. Maverick flies recklessly, but with skill, co-piloted by his best mate Nick ‘Goose’ Bradshaw (Anthony Edwards). Maverick is somewhat haunted by his father’s legacy, also a pilot, whose error whilst flying may have caused his own death and that of others. At the school Maverick encounters competition to be the top pilot from Lieutenant Tom ‘Iceman’ Kazanski (Val Kilmer) who mocks Maverick’s braggadocio and family history. Simultaneously Maverick is attracted to an instructor at the school, Charlie (Kelly McGillis) and is forced to face his personal demons in light of the strengthening feelings for her. “Top gun” features several daredevil flying scenes and has a sub-plot involving a run-in (mid-air) with some rogue Russian pilots. “Top gun” was the highest grossing film of 1986 in the United States. Also starring Tom Skerritt, as a flight instructor, and Meg Ryan as the Goose’s wife.

results.title: Tootsie
results.creator_credit: Sydney Pollack, Dick Richards and Mirage Enterprises
results.brief_description: Nobody will hire the rash Michael Dorsey (Dustin Hoffman) because he has antagonised every producer in New York. When his girlfriend fails an audition for a soap opera; Michael dresses up as “Dorothy Michaels” and lands the part. Michael’s sole conspirators are his agent George and his room mate Geoff. All goes well until “Dorothy” falls in love with beautiful co-star Julie (Jessica Lange) - and Julie’s father falls for “Dorothy.” Co-starring Bill Murray, Teri Garr, Charles Durning and Sydney Pollack.

results.title: Too dirty for a woman
results.creator_credit: Diane Beaudry, Signe Johansson, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In Labrador City, Newfoundland, women have been hired by the Iron Ore Company as truck drivers, engineers, laborers, geologists, warehouse workers, machinists, and mechanics. Living in a company town, they are pioneers in their own community. The women talk about their non-traditional jobs, their new feelings of independence, and how their families’ lives have been affected. One of the consequences is that husbands now share household chores. There are, however, obstacles to be overcome before women can apply for a job, such as the scarcity of day care facilities and a lack of public transportation. Strong visuals show women at work driving a 130-tonne truck, surveying a blast pattern for a drill, or acting as the first female foreman, alias foreperson.

results.title: There are yachts at the bottom of my garden
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Many people believe that eighteen footers are the most exciting boats racing on Sydney Harbour. They certainly attract more spectators than any other class of boat. This film talks about sailing on Sydney Harbour. By contrast with those who live in one of the world’s capitals, such as London, and who may have to drive some distance to reach their boats, the average Sydney sailor is lucky: there are literally yachts at the bottom of the garden.

results.title: There's no place like earth
results.brief_description:
Fantastic interactive work created as part of Project Snap by digital artist Ruth Fleishman and writer Jacinta Parsons in collaboration with local programmer Mark Johnson and Grade 5/6 students of Footscray West Primary on the topic of their local environment.
Each class concentrated on a different environmental theme and combined that with their study of the earth’s atmosphere. The themes include: Earth’s crust; Waterways; Earth’s surface; Troposphere - pollution; Troposphere - global warming.

results.title: Tony Oursler compilation. (Model release. Par-schiz-position. Test)
results.brief_description: Collaborating with writer Constance DeJong, Sonic Youth’s Kim Gordon, and performance artist Karen Finley, Oursler creates a psychedelic trilogy of works exploring the theme of the destruction of the human body through violent projection, psychological as well as electronic. These sequences, in which the talking head format is superimposed on abstracted background images, can be seen to presage the tone and manner of the artist’s related installations. On Model Release, Oursler writes: “Model Release uses legal text to draw parallels between slavery, prostitution, spiritual possession and the practices of the media machine. The viewer is asked to fill-in-the-blanks of the contract and decide what part of their being they are willing to give up”. On Par-Schizoid-Position, Oursler writes: “Paranoid Schizoid Position uses a poetic structure to lead the viewer through the psychological evolution which ends in violent persecution of subgroups in society.” On Test, Oursler writes: “Test was written in the format of the famous psychological examination MMPI (Minneapolis Personality Inventory). The viewer is invited to answer statements relating to media, violence and the body with a simple true or false response. This work is designed to evoke a moment of self reflection in the viewer.

results.title: Theorem = Teorema
results.creator_credit: Pier Pasolini, Manolo Bolognini, Franco Rossellini and Argos Films
results.brief_description: The story is simple - a mysterious stranger (Terence Stamp) arrives at a bourgeois household in Milan and successively seduces the son (Andres Jose Cruz), the mother (Silvana Magnano), the daughter (Anne Wiazemsky) and the father (Massimo Girotti), not forgetting the maid (Laura Betti). As a result of his attentions, the father hands over his factory to the workers, the son abandons his vocation as a painter, the mother gives herself over to random sexual encounters and the daughter sinks into catatonia while the maid becomes a saint. Pasolini uses his schematic plot to prove a point (the bourgeois family is held together by sexual repression) and to explore family dynamics, the intersection of class and sex, and the nature of different sexualities. He also delves into the ‘trouble’ caused by homosexuality. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: There's something about Mary
results.creator_credit: Peter Farrelly, Bobby Farrelly, Bradley Thomas, Charles B. Wessler, Michael Steinberg, Frank Beddor and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1985, nerdy teenager Ted Stroehmann’s luck is about to change when the desirable Mary Jenson chooses him as her prom date. On the actual night, Ted gets his penis caught in his zipper, thus ending a promising evening. 13 years later Ted is still suffering his crush, and decides to track down Mary using the services of a sleazy private investigator, Pat Healy. Ted soon discovers that Pat has not only lied to him about Mary’s life, but has also fallen for her. They both soon discover that virtually every man who sets eyes on Mary finds himself totally enamoured, and once everything and everyone are out in the open, Mary must decide who will win her hand. Cast includes: Cameron Diaz, Matt Dillon, Ben Stiller, Lee Evans and Chris Elliott.

results.title: Theobald faces the facts
results.creator_credit: Cal Dunn, Joe Betzer and Cal Dunn Studios
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon which presents facts that reveal the inaccuracy of mythical fancies concerning the effects of alcoholic beverages. The film technique used is designed for audience participation.
